snippet: The Kings’ Justin Williams, a decent offensive producer in the regular season, is a monster during the playoffs. The Rangers’ Rick Nash, a big-ticket goal scorer, has been virtually unable to score in the postseason.
abstract: Jeff Z Klein On Hockey column observes that Los Angeles Kings winger Justin Williams, a decent offensive producer in the regular season, is a monster during the playoffs, while New York Rangers winger Rick Nash, a big-ticket goal scorer, has been virtually unable to score in the postseason.
lead_paragraph: The Kings’ Justin Williams, a decent offensive producer in the regular season, is a monster during the playoffs. The Rangers’ Rick Nash, a big-ticket goal scorer, has been virtually unable to score in the postseason.

headline.print_headline: Soaring, and Souring, in Postseason Spotlight
headline.seo: Rangers’ Rick Nash Struggles to Find the Net as Kings’ Justin Williams Shines
headline.main: Soaring, and Souring, in Postseason Spotlight
